questiontext.text:
Exercise

A circuit has four independent switches \(A, B, C\) and \(D\) wired in parallel as shown below.

Switches in Parallel

Current can only flow through the bank of switches if at least one is closed.  The probabilities that \(A, B, C\) and \(D\)  are closed are \(\displaystyle{{@aa@}, {@bb@}, {@cc@}}\) and \(\displaystyle{{@dd@}}\) respectively. Calculate the probability that current can flow through the bank of switches.

[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

Hint: First consider the opposite case that the current does not flow.

generalfeedback.text:
Denoting the switches by \(A, B, C\)  and \(D\) we have:

\[\begin{eqnarray*}\text{P}(A\cup B\cup C\cup D)&=&\text{P} (A)+\text{P}(B)+\text{P} (C)+\text{P} (D)-\text{P} (A\cap B)- \text{P} (B\cap C)\\&-& \text{P} (C\cap D- \text{P} (D\cap A)- \text{P} (A\cap C)-\text{P} (B\cap D)\\&+&\text{P} (A\cap B\cap C)+ \text{P} (B\cap C\cap D)+\text{P} (C\cap D\cap A)+\text{P} (D\cap A\cap B)\\&-& \text{P} (A\cap B\cap C\cap D)\end{eqnarray*}\]

Using the fact that the switches operate independently and substituting gives:

\[ \text{P} (A\cup B\cup C\cup D)=3-3.35+1.65-0.3024=0.9976\]

Hence, the probability that current can flow through the bank of switches is \(\displaystyle {@ta@}\).

Alternative solution:

Consider the opposite case where the current does not flow through, then all of the switches need to be open. If \(A\), \(B\), \(C\) and \(D\) represent the event that the respective switch is closed, then the event \(A’ \cap B’ \cap C’ \cap D’\) represents all four switches being closed. As each switch is independent, we have: \[ P(A’\cap B’\cap C’\cap D’) = P(A’)P(B’)P(C’)P(D’) = {@naa@}\times{@nbb@}\times{@ncc@}\times{@ndd@}= \frac{3}{1250}. \] Therefore the probability that the current flows is

\begin{eqnarray*}\text{P}(A\cup B\cup C\cup D)&=&1-\text{P}(A'\cap B'\cap C'\cap D')\\&=&1- \frac{3}{1250}=0.9976.\end{eqnarray*}
